sections: And it only has 27 miles on the clock!
, ultra-low miles, and pristine condition - if this is what you what like hear, this is the
of your dreams. With less than 30 miles on the clock, this final-year first-gen King of the Hill is a car collector's dream.

This 27-mile drive ZR1 was prepped to be a collectible from day one, being stored and documented with all paperwork. This is the kind of bright red supercar that can cause a stir even at the fickle NCRS events, and its possibly the lowest mileage
In addition to being extremely low-mileage,
has the kind of red paint job that jumps out at you. It has a color-matched targa top and optional translucent roof panel, and is essentially fully loaded.

Powering the car is the 32-valve LT5 5.7-liter fuel injected engine. The engine features a special cam cover and this particular car is one of the later build, so has the special Dunn heads. See it here.

Streetside Classics is the nation’s #1 consignment dealer selling over 3,000 vehicles per year for over $100 Million dollars.  With 6 locations nationwide, they charge $0 upfront consignment fees and only collect a commission if your vehicle sells—how great is that?  Why sell privately or through auction when the Streetside team will handle everything from marketing your vehicle, negotiating with the buyer, and even arranging shipping/financing to a worldwide marketplace.  If you’d like to get top dollar, and sell your classic car hassle free, look no further.  You can apply for consignment on their website here:
